keyTakeAways: A former New York prison guard, Robert Brooks, was beaten and died after being attacked by guards upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024.
David Kingsley was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges.

The body-camera footage, which showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, was central to the prosecution’s case and sparked public outrage due to its silent, unmonitored nature.
The guards were charged with acting as a gang, showing a 'depraved indifference to human life,' a legal standard used in murder charges.
Brooks suffered severe injuries including a broken nose, black eye, and internal organ damage, with blood leaking into his lungs and stomach.
William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, took over the case after Attorney General Letitia James recused herself due to representing guards in civil lawsuits.
Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 1, 2025, beating and death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility.
Six of the 10 guards indicted were charged with murder; five pleaded guilty to manslaughter, and one pleaded guilty to attempted tampering with evidence.
Three more guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors, including two who testified at trial.
The incident highlighted systemic issues in prison guard conduct and accountability, especially regarding body-camera use and off-duty violence.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, Robert Brooks, died after being violently beaten by correctional officers upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The incident, captured on silent body-camera footage showing guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck, sparked national outrage. A jury found David Kingsley guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter, while Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer were acquitted of murder charges. The prosecution argued that all guards acted as a gang with a 'depraved indifference to human life,' and that the violence was systemic. William Fitzpatrick, the special prosecutor, took over due to recusal by Attorney General Letitia James, who was representing guards in civil cases. The case is part of a broader pattern of abuse, as Fitzpatrick is also prosecuting guards involved in the March 1, 2025, beating and death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility. Six of 10 guards indicted were charged with murder; five pleaded guilty to manslaughter, and three more have agreed to reduced charges and are cooperating. The incident raises serious concerns about prison guard accountability, use of body-cameras, and systemic abuse in correctional facilities.
title: Former New York state prison guard found guilty in death of inmate beaten, 2 others acquitted
